nodes.text: I'm only an old gleeman. Who could I possibly be dangerous to?
optText: Not a soul Thom. Would you join us on our way to Tar Valon?
Nevermind that, tell us more about your nephew Thom.
What do you think of that shop keeper?
Do you have an extra cloak?

nodes.text: This village has no use for me, now, while on the other hand, I have never performed in Tar Valon. And though I usually journey alone, after last night I have no objections at all to traveling in company.
optText: Let's be off then
You SHOULD NOT see this

nodes.text: My brother's only son, my only living kin. He got in trouble with the Aes Sedai, but I was too busy with...other things.
optText: Go on.
Borrrrring. Goodbye

nodes.text: Owyn died a few years later. You could say Aes Sedai killed him. If I can keep you two free of Tar Valon, maybe I can stop thinking about Owyn.
optText: Would you join us on our way to Tar Valon?
Enough said, farewell.

nodes.text: I say hold your peace. Don't tell anyone, for the time, at least. You can always change your mind, if you have to, but once you tell, it's done, and you're tied up worse than ever.
optText: Thanks for the warning.
Your a crazy old man Thom.

nodes.text: Yes I do, here you go. Keep yourself warm.
optText: Thank you Thom.
Would you join us on our way to Tar Valon?
Nevermind that, tell us more about your nephew Thom.
What do you think of that shop keeper?
Do you have an extra cloak?
This should not have been shown

nodes.text: Padan Fain? He's a Darkfriend no doubt about it.
optText: A Darkfriend? What should we do?
Nevermind forget I asked.
